trans-unit.source: Represents a top-level feed object, <`feed`> in Atom 1.0 and <`rss`> in RSS 2.0.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance is written to a <`feed`> element.
The following table shows how each property defined in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> class is serialized to Atom 1.0.
SyndicationFeed property
Serialized form
An attribute in the <`feed`> element for each attribute in the collection.
An <`author`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection.
A <`category`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> in the collection.
A <`contributor`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection.
A <`rights`> element.
A <`subtitle`> element.
Each element in the collection is written within the <`feed`> element.
A <`generator`> element.
An <`id`>element.
A <`logo`> element.
An <`entry`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> in the collection.
Not serialized.
An <`updated`> element.
A <`link`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the collection.
A <`title`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance is written to an <`rss`> element.
The following table shows how each property defined in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> class is serialized to RSS 2.0.
SyndicationFeed property
Serialized form
An attribute in the <`channel`> element for each attribute in the collection.

A <`managingEditor`> element if only one <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> is in the collection; otherwise, an <`a10:author`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection.
A <`category`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> in the collection.
An <`a10:contributor`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection.
A <`copyright`> element.
A <`description`> element.
Each element in the collection is written within the <`channel`> element.
A <`generator`> element.
An <`a10:id`> element.
An <`image`> element.
An <`item`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> in the collection.
A <`language`> element.
A <`lastBuildDate`> element.
An <`a10:link`> element for each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> in the collection.
A <`title`> element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> class with the specified collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> objects.
The collection of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> objects passed into this constructor is buffered.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> objects.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> class with the specified feed.

If the `cloneItems` parameter is `true`, all <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instances in the source <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance are cloned and added to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Items%2A> collection of the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance.

If the `cloneItems` parameter is `false`, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Items%2A> collection of the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance contains references to the existing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> instances.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> used to initialize the new instance.
A value that specifies whether to clone the items in the source instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> class with the specified title, description, and Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
The title of the feed.
The description of the feed.
The URI for the feed.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> class with the specified title, description, URI, and collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> objects.
The title of the feed.
The description of the feed.
The URI for the feed.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> objects.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> class.
The syndication feed title.
The syndication feed description.
The alternate URI for the syndication feed.
The ID of the syndication feed.
The <xref href="System.DateTimeOffset"></xref> that contains the last time the syndication feed was updated.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> class.
The syndication feed title.
The syndication feed description.
The alternate URI for the syndication feed.
The ID of the syndication feed.
The <xref href="System.DateTimeOffset"></xref> that contains the last time the syndication feed was updated.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> objects.
Gets a collection of attribute extensions.
An attribute extension is a valid XML attribute that is not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, each custom attribute in the collection is written to the <`atom`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, each custom attribute is written to the <`channel`> element.
[!INCLUDE[crexample](~/includes/crexample-md.md)] adding an attribute extension, see the [Loosely-Typed Extensions](~/docs/framework/wcf/samples/loosely-typed-extensions-sample.md) sample.
A dictionary that contains a collection of attribute extensions.
Gets a collection of authors of the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection is written to an <`author`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, if only a single <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> exists in the collection, it is written to a <`managingEditor`> element.
Otherwise, each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> is written to an <`a10:author`> element.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> objects that represents the authors of the feed.
Gets and sets the base URI for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> instance.
The base URI for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> instance.
Gets a collection of categories for the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> in the collection is written to a <`category`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> in the collection is written to a <`category`> element.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> objects that represent the categories for the feed.
Creates a copy of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> instance.

If the `cloneItems` parameter is `true`, all items within the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> object are cloned; otherwise, the new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance's items collection contain references to the original <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance's items.
A value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> objects are cloned.
A duplicate <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> object.
Gets a collection of the contributors to the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection is written to a <`contributor`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> in the collection is written to an <`a10:contributor`> element.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> objects that represents the contributors to the feed.
Gets and sets copyright information for the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Copyright%2A> is written to a <`rights`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Copyright%2A> is written to a <`copyright`> element.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationContent"></xref> object that represents copyright information for the feed.
Creates a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance.
This method does not add the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Categories%2A> collection.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance.
Creates a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
This method does not add the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Items%2A> collection.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> instance.
Creates a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> instance.
The new <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> instance is not added to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> instance used to create it.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> instance.
Creates a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> instance.

This method does not add the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Authors%2A> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Contributors%2A> collections.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson"></xref> instance.
Gets and sets a description of the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Description%2A> is written to a <`subtitle`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Description%2A> is written to a <`description`> element.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent"></xref> object that represents the description of the feed.
Gets the element extensions for the feed.
Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
[!INCLUDE[crexample](~/includes/crexample-md.md)] adding element extensions, see the [Loosely-Typed Extensions](~/docs/framework/wcf/samples/loosely-typed-extensions-sample.md) sample.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationElementExtensionCollection"></xref> instance that contains the element extensions in the feed.
Gets and sets the generator of the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0 and RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Generator%2A> is written to a <`generator`> element.
The name of the tool that generated the feed.
Gets an <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
Gets an <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
Gets a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
The RSS 2.0 specification allows elements and attributes that are not specified in its specification only if they are within a namespace.
When the `serializedExtensionsAsAtom` parameter is `true`, the formatter automatically adds the `a10` namespace qualifier to all extensions; otherwise, the extensions are not serialized.
A value that specifies whether to serialize element and attribute extensions with an Atom 1.0 namespace.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter"></xref> instance.
Gets and sets the ID of the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Id%2A> is written to an <`id`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Id%2A> is written to an <`a10:id`> element.
The ID of the feed.
Gets and sets the image URL for the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.ImageUrl%2A> property is written to a <`logo`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.ImageUrl%2A> property is written to an <`image`> element.
The URL for the image for the feed.
Gets a collection of the feed items contained in the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Items%2A> collection is written to <`entry`> elements.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Items%2A> collection is written to <`item`> elements.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem"></xref> objects.
Gets and sets the language of the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Language%2A> property is written to the `lang` attribute in the <`feed`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Language%2A> property is written to the <`language`> element.
The name of the language the feed is written in.
Gets and sets the time the feed was last updated.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.LastUpdatedTime%2A> property is written to an <`updated`>element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.LastUpdatedTime%2A> property is written to a <`lastBuildDate`> element.
A <xref href="System.DateTimeOffset"></xref> instance set to the time the feed was last updated.
Gets the links associated with the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Links%2A> collection is written to a number of <`link`> elements.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Links%2A> collection is written to a number of <`a10:link`> elements.
A collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink"></xref> objects.
Loads a syndication feed from the specified XML reader.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to load the feed from.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref> that contains the loaded contents.
Loads a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref>-derived instance from the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>.
Use this method when you are loading a syndication item into a class derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The syndication feed type.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed"></xref>-derived instance that contains the feed.
Invalid XML encountered during read.
Write the syndication feed to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> in Atom 1.0 format.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write to.
Write the syndication feed to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> in RSS 2.0 format.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write to.
Gets and sets the title of the feed.
When serialized to Atom 1.0 and RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed.Title%2A> property is written to a <`title`> element.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent"></xref> instance that contains the title of the feed.
Attempts to parse an attribute extension.
Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
They are serialized as an attribute of the <`feed`> (for Atom 1.0) or <`rss`> (for RSS 1.0) element, which depends upon the syndication version being used.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom attribute extension.
To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.
The name of the element.
The namespace of the element.
The attribute to parse.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that specifies whether the attribute extension was parsed successfully.
Invalid XML Encountered during read.
Attempts to parse an element extension.
Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom element extension.
To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The syndication version to use while parsing.
A value that specifies whether the element extension was parsed successfully.
Invalid XML encountered during read.
Writes the attribute extensions to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> using the specified syndication version.
Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
They are serialized as an attribute of the <`feed`> (for Atom 1.0) or <`rss`> (for RSS 1.0) element, which depends upon the syndication version being used.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom attribute extensions.
To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to write to.
The syndication version to use while writing.
Writes the element extensions to the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> using the specified syndication version.
Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom element extensions.
To do this, you must derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to write to.
The syndication version to use while writing.
